title: ISO 8601 Date/Time Parser
description: Parse ISO 8601 date, time, and datetime strings - the international standard for date and time representations used across systems and languages.

motivation.why: ISO 8601 is the international standard for date and time interchange. It's used in APIs, databases, logs, and any system that needs unambiguous date/time representation across cultures and timezones.

inputFormat.description: ISO 8601 supports multiple formats: calendar dates (YYYY-MM-DD), week dates (YYYY-Www-D), ordinal dates (YYYY-DDD), times with optional fractions and timezones, and durations (PnYnMnDTnHnMnS).
inputFormat.syntax: YYYY-MM-DD | YYYY-Www-D | YYYY-DDD | HH:MM:SS | YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ | PnYnMnDTnHnMnS

examples.description: Duration (1 year, 2 months, 3 days, 4 hours, 5 minutes, 6 seconds)

outputFormat.description: The parser returns structured types for dates (IsoDate), times (IsoTime), datetimes (IsoDateTime), and durations (IsoDuration), each with properly typed fields.

IsoDate.description: year, month, day, week, weekday, ordinal_day fields

IsoTime.description: hour, minute, second, fraction, timezone fields

IsoDuration.description: years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds fields
